lines.text:
[voice over narration]
Jouve's sister was unbearably beautiful. She always rode wither skirts flying. Bernadette led us to discover many of our darkly hidden dreams. She awoke in us the springs of luminous sensuality.

[voice over narration]
But one autumn day in October Bernadette Jouve passed us, not seeing us. Later I recalled the event more with pity than shame, but I have a bitter memory of her gone from our childhood skies, the way she'd disappear around a corner with her skirts flying.
A virginal heartbeat has its own juvenile logic.
